job_description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering teams.
  • Monitor, detect, and respond to security threats, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Optimize system reliability, scalability, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge (LAN/WAN, firewalls, load balancers).
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and secure CI/CD pipelines. Requires 4–8 years of DevOps/cloud experience with expertise in Terraform, Ansible, and AWS.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modelling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling, requirement clarity, and cross-team collaboration to drive aligned product development with testable outcomes.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and alignment across development and testing phases. Responsibilities include creating BRDs/SRS, managing traceability, and supporting project delivery through accurate documentation.

Requirements - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in education/training/experience. - 2 - 5 years of B2B sales experience in IT services/digital solutions. - Proven ability to manage sales pipelines and close deals independently. - Strong knowledge of software development services (web, mobile, SaaS, enterprise). - Experience with international clients preferred. - Familiarity with CRM systems (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce) and outbound tools (LinkedIn Sales Navigator). - Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. - Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. - Strategic thinking to address client pain points and position solutions.

Senior Architect - Software

At Fingent, we believe that technology can make a meaningful difference to the lives around us. We create and provide software that is beautiful, usable, and compelling to solve complex business challenges. We nurture smart people who bring out the best in themselves, their peers, and their clients. We are looking for an experienced Senior Techno-Functional Project Manager to join our Project Management Office (PMO) and help us continue our mission.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Technical Architect who brings a system-wide perspective across backend, frontend, mobile, infrastructure, data, and operations—and who can connect the dots end-to-end for an on-demand platform. You will partner closely with the leadership team to shape how the platform is built, evolved, operated, and augmented with AI over time. You will play a key role in moving the organization toward a pragmatic, AI-driven development and operations model, starting from the MVP and maturing iteratively.

Key Responsibilities - Design scalable, cloud-native architecture for real-time delivery operations (order management, dispatch, routing, tracking) - Mentor a high-performing engineering team - Own technical decisions on microservices architecture, databases, APIs, and integration patterns - Establish development practices, CI/CD pipelines, and operational excellence standards - Partner with product and business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions - Ensure system reliability, user experience, performance, and security at scale

Required Experience - 10+ years in software development with 3+ years in architect/principal engineer roles - Proven track record building real-time, high-transaction platforms (marketplace, logistics, or on-demand systems) - Deep expertise in distributed systems, microservices, event-driven architecture - Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP), containerization, and orchestration - Hands-on with modern tech stacks, AI-assisted development, and architecture decisions - Experience building and leading technical teams of 5–10 engineers

Preferred Skills - Prior work on delivery, logistics, or two-sided marketplace platforms - Expertise in geospatial systems, routing algorithms, and real-time tracking - Knowledge of mobile backend architectures and API design - Experience with ML/AI integration for demand forecasting or route optimization

Contact If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@fingent.com.

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are trusted by leading global organizations to support sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale. With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work.

Location: Technopark Phase1, Trivandrum

Role Overview

We’re seeking a Technical Architect / Technical Lead with deep Node.js expertise to architect scalable backend systems and provide hands-on technical leadership. This is a highly technical role focused on architecture, code quality, and mentoring teams.

Key Responsibilities

Technical Architecture (Primary)

  • Design and architect scalable Node.js backend systems
  • Establish technical standards, design patterns, and best practices
  • Hands-on development and code reviews
  • Solve complex technical challenges and optimize system performance
  • Drive technical innovation and evaluate new technologies
  • Create technical documentation and architecture diagrams

Team Leadership

  • Mentor developers and conduct technical training
  • Lead technical discussions and design reviews
  • Foster engineering excellence culture

Project Coordination (Secondary)

  • Provide technical estimates and track deliverables
  • Communicate progress and risks to stakeholders

Preferred Skills & Experience

  • 6+ years in software development
  • 4+ years expert-level Node.js backend experience
  • 1+ year as Technical Architect/Lead
  • Proven track record with large-scale production systems

Technical Skills

  • Expert in Node.js, NestJS (preferred)/Express.js/Fastify
  • Advanced TypeScript/JavaScript
  • Microservices and distributed systems design
  • RESTful API and GraphQL
  • Design patterns, DDD, Clean Architecture
  • Asynchronous programming, event-driven architecture
  • SQL (PostgreSQL/MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB)
  • ORM/ODM (Sequelize, TypeORM, Prisma)
  • Docker, Kubernetes
  • AWS/GCP and serverless architectures
  • CI/CD pipelines
  • Message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS)
  • Redis caching strategies
  • Security best practices (OAuth, JWT, OWASP)
  • Testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha)
  • Performance optimization and monitoring (ELK, Datadog)

Soft Skills

  • Excellent technical communication
  • Strong problem-solving abilities
  • Collaborative and self-motivated

Preferred

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • Experience with frontend technologies (React, Vue.js, Angular) for full-stack perspective
  • Knowledge of Python, Go, or Java for polyglot architecture
  • Experience with real-time applications (WebSockets, Socket.io)
  • Open source contributions and active GitHub profile
  • Background in Manufacturing domain or SaaS Platforms

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations like Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and others.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Backed by ISO certifications for quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we build long-term relationships and create a sustainable future for our people, clients, and organization. From continuous learning to meaningful ownership, we support you at every stage. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.
